defs.docs: Substrate externalities abstraction

attributes.value: ! Substrate externalities abstraction
! The externalities mainly provide access to storage and to registered extensions. Extensions
! are for example the keystore or the offchain externalities. These externalities are used to
! access the node from the runtime via the runtime interfaces.
! This crate exposes the main [`Externalities`] trait.

defs.name: Extension
defs.docs: Marker trait for types that should be registered as [`Externalities`](crate::Externalities) extension.

attributes.value: / Marker trait for types that should be registered as [`Externalities`](crate::Externalities) extension.
/ As extensions are stored as `Box<Any>`, this trait should give more confidence that the correct
/ type is registered and requested.

defs.name: as_mut_any
defs.docs: Return the extension as `&mut dyn Any`.

attributes.value: / Return the extension as `&mut dyn Any`.
/ This is a trick to make the trait type castable into an `Any`.

defs.name: ExtensionStore
defs.docs: Something that provides access to the [`Extensions`] store.

attributes.value: / Something that provides access to the [`Extensions`] store.
/ This is a super trait of the [`Externalities`](crate::Externalities).

defs.name: extension_by_type_id
defs.value: fn (&mut self, type_id: TypeId) -> Option<&mut dyn Any>
defs.docs: Tries to find a registered extension by the given `type_id` and returns it as a `&mut dyn Any`.

attributes.value: / Tries to find a registered extension by the given `type_id` and returns it as a `&mut dyn Any`.
/ It is advised to use [`ExternalitiesExt::extension`](crate::ExternalitiesExt::extension)
/ instead of this function to get type system support and automatic type downcasting.

defs.name: register_extension_with_type_id
defs.value: fn (&mut self, type_id: TypeId, extension: Box<dyn Extension>) -> Result<(), Error>
defs.docs: Register extension `extension` with speciifed `type_id`.

attributes.value: / Register extension `extension` with speciifed `type_id`.
/ It should return error if extension is already registered.

defs.name: deregister_extension_by_type_id
defs.value: fn (&mut self, type_id: TypeId) -> Result<(), Error>
defs.docs: Deregister extension with speicifed 'type_id' and drop it.

attributes.value: / Deregister extension with speicifed 'type_id' and drop it.
/ It should return error if extension is not registered.

defs.name: set_and_run_with_externalities
defs.value: fn <F, R> (ext: &mut dyn Externalities, f: F) -> R
defs.docs:
Set the given externalities while executing the given closure. To get access to the externalities
 while executing the given closure [`with_externalities`] grants access to them. The externalities
 are only set for the same thread this function was called from.

attributes.value: / Set the given externalities while executing the given closure. To get access to the externalities
/ while executing the given closure [`with_externalities`] grants access to them. The externalities
/ are only set for the same thread this function was called from.

defs.name: with_externalities
defs.docs: Execute the given closure with the currently set externalities.

attributes.value: / Execute the given closure with the currently set externalities.
/ Returns `None` if no externalities are set or `Some(_)` with the result of the closure.

defs.docs: Same extension cannot be registered twice.

attributes.value: / Same extension cannot be registered twice.

/ Provides access to the storage and to other registered extensions.

defs.docs: Get the identity of the chain.

defs.name: storage_root
defs.docs: Get the trie root of the current storage map.

attributes.value: / Get the trie root of the current storage map.
/ This will also update all child storage keys in the top-level storage map.
/ The returned hash is defined by the `Block` and is SCALE encoded.

defs.name: child_storage_root
defs.docs: Get the trie root of a child storage map.

attributes.value: / Get the trie root of a child storage map.
/ This will also update the value of the child storage keys in the top-level storage map.
/ If the storage root equals the default hash as defined by the trie, the key in the top-level
/ storage map will be removed.

defs.name: storage_append
defs.value: fn (&mut self, key: Vec<u8>, value: Vec<u8>) -> ()
defs.docs: Append storage item.

attributes.value: / Append storage item.
/ This assumes specific format of the storage item. Also there is no way to undo this operation.

defs.name: storage_changes_root
defs.docs: Get the changes trie root of the current storage overlay at a block with given `parent`.

attributes.value: / Get the changes trie root of the current storage overlay at a block with given `parent`.
/ `parent` expects a SCALE encoded hash.
/ The returned hash is defined by the `Block` and is SCALE encoded.
/ Benchmarking related functionality and shouldn't be used anywhere else!
/ Wipes all changes from caches and the database.
/ The state will be reset to genesis.
/ Benchmarking related functionality and shouldn't be used anywhere else!
/ Commits all changes to the database and clears all caches.

defs.name: register_extension
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, ext: T) -> Result<(), Error>
defs.docs: Register extension `ext`.

attributes.value: / Register extension `ext`.
/ Should return error if extension is already registered or extensions are not supported.

defs.name: deregister_extension
defs.docs: Deregister and drop extension of `T` type.

attributes.value: / Deregister and drop extension of `T` type.
/ Should return error if extension of type `T` is not registered or
/ extensions are not supported.
